programme.desc: Two matches of Sky Bet League 1 semi-final play-off action couldn't separate Charlton Athletic and Doncaster Rovers in 2019, as a date at Wembley hinged on a dramatic penalty shootout.

programme.title: EFL Cup 21/22: Chelsea v Liverpool

programme.desc: Brand new series - Love Me Tender: Jared and Kyle clash. There's a difficult docking. Eileen gets under everyone's skin. And a night in the hot tub has repercussions.

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The Goggleboxers have been watching: The Coronation - and The Coronation Concert - First Dates, The 1% Club, The Greatest Auction, Made in Chelsea and BBC News (local elections).

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: It's Eurovision this time. Also, Citadel, The Greatest Auction, Family Fortunes, Open House: The Great Sex Experiment, I Kissed a Boy and The Big Celebrity Detox.

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Will romance blossom for pest controller Adam and Naomi from Essex, a glamorous granny and a poet, or a working mum with a sideline selling and renting sex dolls?

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Euclid Alternative: When Leonard can't drive Sheldon to and from work, the friends stage an intervention to overcome Sheldon's fear of getting behind the wheel.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Cooper-Nowitzki Theorem: Sheldon's friends are mystified when a younger student is attracted to him, but her intense devotion soon becomes too much to bear.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: My Fair Laddy: Lisa tries to transform Groundskeeper Willie into a gentleman after his shack collapses and he's forced to move in with the Simpsons.

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: The Big House (Part 1): Adjusting to life behind bars, Peralta bonds with a cellmate and is forced to join a prison gang, while Diaz puts her visitors to the test.

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: The Big House (Part 2): Peralta is trapped by divided loyalties after the warden persuades him to investigate prison gang leader Romero's drug smuggling operation.

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: The Strangest Affair of All Time: When Murray goes out of town, Jane Bales attempts to make a power grab at the Ottoman Empire, forcing Beverly to retaliate.

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: School-Ercise: As Beverly steps in to teach gym class at William Penn, Barry and Geoff compete for a prized summer internship.

programme.title: Below Deck
programme.desc: Brand new series - Love Me Tender: Jared and Kyle clash. There's a difficult docking. Eileen gets under everyone's skin. And a night in the hot tub has repercussions.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay revisits four restaurants he tried to help: the Spanish Pavillion in New Jersey, and Kingston Caf, La Frite and Capri in California.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Do Not Push: A campus tour becomes an emotionally and psychologically charged experience for the Dunphys.

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: The Big House (Part 1): Adjusting to life behind bars, Peralta bonds with a cellmate and is forced to join a prison gang, while Diaz puts her visitors to the test.

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Sienna throws a pre-wedding party for Jez and John Paul. Liberty battles with jealousy, Mercedes gets a call that changes everything, and Martha's confusion leads to a chilling revelation.

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: On the eve of Jez and John Paul's wedding, secrets explode, and John Paul begins to doubt everything. Dodger receives some shocking information, and Bobby risks his life to clear his name.

programme.title: Rude(ish) Tube Shorts
programme.desc: A short, cheeky clip from Rude Tube's naughty little sister, Rude(ish) Tube, featuring sports of the lawnmower, motorbike and bicycle variety.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: La Galleria 33 (Part 2): The saga of Boston eatery La Galleria 33 comes to a dramatic conclusion as Gordon Ramsay gives restaurant owners and sisters Rita and Lisa an ultimatum.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Mama Maria: Gordon Ramsay visits Mama Maria's, a failing restaurant in Brooklyn, New York, where owner John is overwhelmed by running a business that's become stuck in the past.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Old Yeller Belly: Santa's Little Helper becomes Duff Beer's new mascot after he's banished from the Simpson home for failing to save Homer from a tree house fire.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Brake My Wife, Please: When Homer is banned from driving, Marge gets stressed ferrying everyone around, but Homer enjoys walking everywhere - until Marge crashes into him.

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: A Tornado, a Ten-Hour Flight and a Darn Fine Ring: Sheldon and Mary visit Germany. The rest of the Cooper family brave a tornado heading straight for Medford.

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: A Wiener Schnitzel and Underwear in a Tree: In the first episode of the final series, news of the tornado reaches Sheldon and Mary in Germany.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Sarge & Pea: Cam is incensed when a rude parent robs him of a precious Lily moment during her dance recital. Jay, Claire and Mitch unexpectedly run into Dede at a family wedding.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Do You Believe in Magic? Worried that his romance with Claire is fizzling out, Phil calls upon his alter ego, Clive Bixby, to get Valentines Day back on track.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: The Cold: Phil must get rid of some incriminating footage on Mitch and Cam's wedding video.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Explosion Implosion: Howard and Sheldon bond on a trip to the desert to launch a model rocket. Leonard is annoyed when his mother befriends Penny.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Collaboration Contamination: Sheldon and Raj ask Bernadette for advice about their jealousy when Amy and Howard decide to collaborate on a new project.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Proton Regeneration: Sheldon goes head-to-head with Wil Wheaton as they compete for the role of the new Professor Proton when the TV series has a reboot.

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: Community Service and the Key to a Happy Marriage: Meemaw gets assigned a tough probation officer, and Georgie takes marriage advice from his father-in-law.

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: A Little Snip and Teaching Old Dogs: George Sr is worried that Mary wants another baby, so he gets a secret vasectomy. Linkletter and Sturgis ask Sheldon for help.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: The Burns and the Bees: Mr Burns wins a basketball team in a game of poker, then decides to build a stadium on top of Lisa's bee colony.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Lisa the Drama Queen: Lisa and her new friend Juliet (Emily Blunt) create a fantasy world that takes them a bit too far from reality.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Reclusive Potential: A brilliant scientist invites Sheldon to his isolated cabin, and Leonard, Raj and Howard go along for the trip.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Comet Polarization: Sheldon isn't pleased by the comic book shop's new-found popularity. Raj tries to take the credit for Penny's astronomical discovery.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Monetary Insufficiency: Sheldon goes to Las Vegas to try to win money for science. Penny and Bernadette take Amy shopping for a wedding dress.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Sibling Realignment: When Sheldon finds out that his mum won't come to his wedding unless he invites his brother Georgie, he and Leonard head to Texas.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Bart Has Two Mommies: Marge babysits Rod and Todd, but Ned overreacts when she lets them play on a climbing wall. Bart gets pulled into a chimp cage at the zoo.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer Simpson, This Is Your Wife: Homer signs the family up for a wife swap show, but easy-going husband Charlie (Ricky Gervais) develops a crush on Marge...

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Jez and John Paul are about to tie the knot, but Jez has loose ends to tie up - no matter the cost. Elsewhere, a resident is stood up. And can Bobby escape the village before it's too late?

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: The Homer They Fall: Homer becomes a boxer, thanks to his abnormally hard head. But is his skull strong enough for a fight against heavyweight champion Drederick Tatum?

programme.title: New: Below Deck
programme.desc: Brand new series - Cat's Out of the Bag: Jared's in hot water, while Ben finds himself in a difficult position. A stew gets troubling news, and a shock decision rocks the boat.

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: On the 'Box this time: Casualty, Queer Eye, Below Deck Sailing Yacht, FUBAR, Open House: The Great Sex Experiment, Big Beasts and BBC News(Phillip Schofield).

programme.title: The Equalizer
programme.desc: (2014) Thriller. Denzel Washington stars as an ex-soldier who comes out of retirement to help a teenage sex worker who's been assaulted by her pimp.

programme.title: The Long Good Friday
programme.desc: (1980) Bob Hoskins and Helen Mirren star in John MacKenzie's East London gangster thriller. Gang leader Hoskins' hold over his empire is under threat.

programme.title: Isle of Dogs
programme.desc: (2018) Wes Anderson's animated comedy with Bryan Cranston and Bill Murray. A boy breaks his beloved pet out of doggy exile in a future, dystopian Japan. May not be suitable for young kids.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Muppets from Space
programme.desc: (1999) The Muppets are back in another feature-length adventure as Gonzo, convinced that he is of alien origin, struggles to communicate with his family in outer space.

programme.title: Napoleon Dynamite
programme.desc: (2004) Quirky high-school comedy starring Jon Heder as a nerdy teenager from an eccentric family, who gains a new-found respect when he organises his friend's student election campaign.

programme.title: Sister Act
programme.desc: (1992) Comedy starring Whoopi Goldberg. A casino singer who witnesses a Mob murder goes into hiding at a convent, where she soon has the choir rocking. With Maggie Smith.

programme.title: Sister Act 2: Back in the Habit
programme.desc: (1993) Comedy sequel starring Whoopi Goldberg and Lauryn Hill. Deloris - who's now made it big in Vegas - goes back undercover as a teacher to help a struggling school choir find its voice.

programme.title: Dog
programme.desc: (2022) Poignant road-trip comedy with Channing Tatum. A soldier with PTSD must escort a traumatised army canine to a comrade's funeral. Can man and dog save each other's lives?

programme.title: The Transporter
programme.desc: (2002) Action-thriller starring Jason Statham. For a price, an underworld courier will deliver people or packages anywhere, no questions asked. But one job lands him in deep danger.

programme.title: Open Range
programme.desc: (2003) Kevin Costner's western with Robert Duvall and Michael Gambon. A small band of free grazers are forced to take on a local rancher and his hired thugs.

programme.title: Genova
programme.desc: (2008) Supernatural drama. A widower (Colin Firth) takes his daughters to Italy to find some solace for their loss, but once there, their memories are dangerously stirred. Strong language.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: LumoTV: The Beautiful Game
programme.desc: Documentary. Footballer Marios Costi travels across Europe to meet some of the teams preparing for the Deaf Champions League 2019. (Ep1/2)

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Anzio
programme.desc: (1968) Epic Second World War drama starring Robert Mitchum. A reporter gets trapped behind enemy lines during the costly 1944 Allied invasion of Italy. With Peter Falk and Robert Ryan.

programme.title: Suffragette Interview Special
programme.desc: Writer Abi Morgan, director Sarah Gavron and star Anne-Marie Duff talk about their powerful period political drama Suffragette.

programme.title: Patton
programme.desc: (1970) Multi-Oscar-winning, fact-based, Second World War drama starring George C Scott, who gives a vivid portrait of the famously straight-talking US commander General George Patton.

programme.title: The Man from Laramie
programme.desc: (1955) Classic western. James Stewart plays a stranger who arrives in a remote New Mexico town secretly seeking his brother's killer. With Donald Crisp, Alex Nicol and Arthur Kennedy.

programme.title: Suffragette
programme.desc: (2015) Drama exploring the increasingly defiant campaign by British women for equality and the right to vote in the years before WWI. Starring Carey Mulligan and Meryl Streep.

programme.title: Transporter 2
programme.desc: (2005) Violent action-thriller starring Jason Statham as the tough courier Frank Martin, who's hired to guard a government drugs czar's son. But his mission soon lurches towards disaster.

programme.title: Mission: Impossible - Rogue Nation
programme.desc: (2015) Part five of the Tom Cruise action-thriller franchise. The secret agents must bring down a terrorist group, but that's not easy when the CIA are hunting you down...

programme.title: Fantasy Island
programme.desc: (2020) Horror with Michael Pea, Lucy Hale and Maggie Q, inspired by the 70s TV series. Five visitors to a luxury island are promised their wildest desires - but there are conditions...

programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Hell Is a City
programme.desc: (1960) Classic crime thriller with Stanley Baker and Billie Whitelaw. A world-weary detective with a messy private life tracks a violent thief through the streets of Manchester.

programme.title: Yesterday's Enemy
programme.desc: (1959) Wartime drama with Stanley Baker. The captain of a British army patrol deciphers secret enemy battle plans, but does so at a great moral cost.

programme.title: The 300 Spartans
programme.desc: (1962) Historical drama with Ralph Richardson. A retelling of the stand made at Thermopylae in 480 BC by a small Greek force against invasion by an enormous Persian army.

programme.title: Gunman's Walk
programme.desc: (1958) Western. Van Heflin stars as a veteran frontiersman whose determination to mould his sons in his gun-totin' image backfires disastrously. With Tab Hunter and James Darren.

programme.title: A Beautiful Day in the...
programme.desc: ...Neighborhood: (2019) Biographical drama starring Tom Hanks as 'Mister' Rogers, the much-loved host of a kids TV show, who becomes the subject of a cynical journalist's article on heroes.

programme.title: Notting Hill

programme.title: The Burnt Orange Heresy
programme.desc: (2019) Artworld thriller with Mick Jagger and Donald Sutherland. An art lecturer and his girlfriend are tasked with making a reclusive artist an offer he can't refuse.

programme.desc: (2004) Quirky high-school comedy starring Jon Heder as a nerdy teenager from an eccentric family, who gains a new-found respect when he organises his friend's student election campaign.

programme.title: Sister Act
programme.desc: (1992) Comedy starring Whoopi Goldberg. A casino singer who witnesses a Mob murder goes into hiding at a convent, where she soon has the choir rocking. With Maggie Smith.

programme.title: Sister Act 2: Back in the Habit
programme.desc: (1993) Comedy sequel starring Whoopi Goldberg and Lauryn Hill. Deloris - who's now made it big in Vegas - goes back undercover as a teacher to help a struggling school choir find its voice.

programme.title: Dog
programme.desc: (2022) Poignant road-trip comedy with Channing Tatum. A soldier with PTSD must escort a traumatised army canine to a comrade's funeral. Can man and dog save each other's lives?

programme.title: The Transporter
programme.desc: (2002) Action-thriller starring Jason Statham. For a price, an underworld courier will deliver people or packages anywhere, no questions asked. But one job lands him in deep danger.

programme.title: Open Range
programme.desc: (2003) Kevin Costner's western with Robert Duvall and Michael Gambon. A small band of free grazers are forced to take on a local rancher and his hired thugs.

programme.title: Genova
programme.desc: (2008) Supernatural drama. A widower (Colin Firth) takes his daughters to Italy to find some solace for their loss, but once there, their memories are dangerously stirred. Strong language.

programme.title: Suffragette Interview Special
programme.desc: Writer Abi Morgan, director Sarah Gavron and star Anne-Marie Duff talk about their powerful period political drama Suffragette.

programme.title: Patton
programme.desc: (1970) Multi-Oscar-winning, fact-based, Second World War drama starring George C Scott, who gives a vivid portrait of the famously straight-talking US commander General George Patton.

programme.title: The Man from Laramie
programme.desc: (1955) Classic western. James Stewart plays a stranger who arrives in a remote New Mexico town secretly seeking his brother's killer. With Donald Crisp, Alex Nicol and Arthur Kennedy.

programme.title: Suffragette
programme.desc: (2015) Drama exploring the increasingly defiant campaign by British women for equality and the right to vote in the years before WWI. Starring Carey Mulligan and Meryl Streep.

programme.title: Transporter 2
programme.desc: (2005) Violent action-thriller starring Jason Statham as the tough courier Frank Martin, who's hired to guard a government drugs czar's son. But his mission soon lurches towards disaster.

programme.title: Mission: Impossible - Rogue Nation
programme.desc: (2015) Part five of the Tom Cruise action-thriller franchise. The secret agents must bring down a terrorist group, but that's not easy when the CIA are hunting you down...

programme.title: Fantasy Island
programme.desc: (2020) Horror with Michael Pea, Lucy Hale and Maggie Q, inspired by the 70s TV series. Five visitors to a luxury island are promised their wildest desires - but there are conditions...

programme.title: The 300 Spartans
programme.desc: (1962) Historical drama with Ralph Richardson. A retelling of the stand made at Thermopylae in 480 BC by a small Greek force against invasion by an enormous Persian army.

programme.title: Gunman's Walk
programme.desc: (1958) Western. Van Heflin stars as a veteran frontiersman whose determination to mould his sons in his gun-totin' image backfires disastrously. With Tab Hunter and James Darren.

programme.title: A Beautiful Day in the...

programme.title: Press Preview
programme.desc: Lively debate and discussion with our panel of paper reviewers about the stories making tomorrow morning's newspapers.

programme.title: Tour de France Highlights
programme.desc: Action from stage 14, which consisted of a 182.6km route from Pau to the ski resort of Luchon-Superbagnres. Gary Imlach presents, with analysis from Pete Kennaugh, commentary by Ned Boulting and David Millar, and interviews from reporters Daniel Friebe and Matt Rendell

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Shark! Celebrity Infested Waters
programme.desc: Lenny Henry, Lucy Punch, Helen George, Rachel Riley, Ade Adepitan, Dougie Poynter and Ross Noble head to the Bahamas to swim with man-eating sharks. Experts Danni Washington and Tristan Guttridge and shark attack survivor Paul de Gelder are the mentors whose mission is to help the celebrities conquer their fears and teach them to love this notorious predator

programme.title: John and Lisa's Weekend Kitchen
programme.desc: John Torode and Lisa Faulkner make four mouth-watering dishes with only five main ingredients, starting with a garlic and rosemary focaccia, followed by John's pink spaghetti. Following that are chicken and peanut butter scissor-cut noodles and moreish and fuss-free banana doughnuts.

programme.title: Flushed Away
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure featuring the voices of Hugh Jackman, Kate Winslet and Ian McKellen. Posh rodent Roddy St James leads a sheltered life in a Kensington mansion, with his every need catered for by his wealthy owners. But his life as a pampered pet comes to an end when he's flushed down the toilet to a subterranean world where the population is being threatened by an evil toad.

programme.title: Katie Piper's Weekend Escape
programme.desc: Katie is joined by Steps' Lee Latchford-Evans to make a mini allotment, hairdresser Michael Douglas and make-up artist Genevieve Turley transform a supportive sister, and JJ Goodman serves up more delicious drinks

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Love Your Weekend with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Joining Alan to provide the chat this time are Selina Scott, Pixie Lott and Tom Parker-Bowles, and we also meet some rare-breed Guernsey goats with a royal title.

programme.title: Ninja Warrior UK
programme.desc: Competitors from across the nation test their strength, speed and courage in this obstacle-course challenge, with celebrity contestants including professional skater Sylvain Longchambon, singer Joe McElderry, and Olympian snowboarder Aimee Fuller competing alongside members of the public. Hosted by Ben Shephard, Rochelle Humes and Chris Kamara

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Mrs Doubtfire
programme.desc: Comedy drama starring Robin Williams, Sally Field and Pierce Brosnan. When voiceover artist Daniel Hillard walks out of his day job, his wife Miranda decides it's time to walk out on him, and is granted custody of their children. Daniel is desperate to be with his kids, so when Miranda advertises for a nanny-cum-housekeeper he applies for the job in disguise.

programme.title: The Spy Who Loved Me
programme.desc: Spy adventure starring Roger Moore and Barbara Bach. James Bond sets out to stop an evil shipping magnate who is capturing nuclear submarines by means of a secret tracking device. Bond finds help in the unlikely shape of a beautiful KGB agent, and a formidable enemy in steel-toothed killer Jaws.

programme.title: Sean's Scotland
programme.desc: Sean travels to Perth and Kinross, visiting Loch of the Lowes Visitor Centre and Wildlife Reserve to learn about the ospreys that return there to mate

programme.title: The People's History Show
programme.desc: There is a visit to Dounreay nuclear power plant, Atta Yaqub learns about footballer-turned-writer Neil Paterson, and Jennifer Reoch finds out about the thread industry in Paisley

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Celebrity Catchphrase
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts as contestants Mark Bonnar, Alexandra Burke and Claire Sweeney 'see it and say it' as they try to guess the familiar phrases hidden in animated clues. After the first elimination, the two remaining players battle to reach the Super Catchphrase round, where one of them could win 50,000 for the charity of their choice

programme.title: Karen Pirie
programme.desc: Amid societal unrest in 1984, oil heiress Catriona Grant and her son Adam are kidnapped at gunpoint, but after sending two ransom notes the culprits unexpectedly fall silent and the pair are never seen again. When a man's body is discovered 40 years later in a quarry with a piece of evidence connected to the case, DI Karen Pirie is tasked with reopening the case with the first new lead in decades. Return of the crime drama based on the series of novels by Val McDermid, starring Lauren Lyle

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Breaking the Silence: Kate's Story
programme.desc: Former MP Kate Kniveton gives a frank and full insight into her experience of being abused and shamed into silence over 10 years by her ex-husband Andrew Griffiths, who was then a Conservative government minister. Kate also meets other high-achieving professional women who were secretly suffering appalling abuse behind closed doors and who, like her, felt there was no way they could escape the relationship. In this powerful documentary for the Exposure strand, Kate also sheds new light on the secretive world of the family court and shows how perpetrators can play the system to continue their abuse and how judges can get it badly wrong when it comes to protecting survivors and their children

programme.title: The Assembly
programme.desc: Footballer-turned-presenter Gary Lineker gets the grilling of a lifetime as he faces questions from autistic and learning-disabled interviewers, asking if he was forced out by the BBC and who the worst person he has worked with is. From the Hand of God to his first love, no question is off the table and no subject out of bounds when it comes to the Assembly's line of enquiry - expect revelations, chaos, and a lot of laughs

programme.title: Motorsport UK
programme.desc: Richard John Neil presents action from Snetterton featuring racing from the Wera Tools F4 British Championship and The Vertu MINI CHALLENGE.

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.desc: Action stage 15, which consisted of a 169.3km route from Muret to Carcassonne. Gary Imlach presents, with analysis from Pete Kennaugh, commentary by Ned Boulting and David Millar, and interviews from reporters Daniel Friebe and Matt Rendell

programme.desc: Celebrity interviews and studio discussion from a female perspective

programme.title: Celebrity Catchphrase
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts as contestants Beverley Callard, Kirsty Gallacher and Stephen K Amos 'see it and say it' as they try to guess the familiar phrases hidden in animated clues. After the first elimination, the two remaining players battle to reach the Super Catchphrase round, where one of them could win 50,000 for the charity of their choice

programme.title: Lingo
programme.desc: This time, Sophia and her husband James from Surrey, Welsh couple Rhydian and Jamie, and junior doctor Becky and her mum Julie from Leeds try to work out words that appear in the Lingo grids and Puzzlewords. Presented by Adil Ray

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Mario from Ipswich, Emma originally from Barnsley, Jacqueline from Surrey and Greg from Nottingham pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast

programme.title: ITV Evening News
programme.desc: A round-up of the day's news headlines and talking points from the UK and around the world

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Liam makes a discovery. while Robert's suspicions are piqued and Pollard tells Mack the truth

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Ryan worries about Debbie's behaviour at work, Dev absolves Aadi of any guilt for the robbery, Lou asks a massive favour of Sally, and Billy overhears Theo lying to an old friend

programme.title: Shark! Celebrity Infested Waters
programme.desc: The famous faces discover their final mission will be to swim with 18-foot tiger sharks. Ade Adepitan struggles to master his special diving equipment during a training exercise and makes a mad dash for a boat with sharks all around him. Meanwhile, Lucy Punch and Ross Noble find themselves in 'predator alley', Helen George suffers a panic attack and falls behind the team during scuba training, and the stars enjoy a spectacular coral reef dive before learning about their next encounter

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: Yorkshire Ripper: The Secret Murders
programme.desc: Part one of two. Examining the police investigation into the crimes of serial killer Peter Sutcliffe, known as the Yorkshire Ripper, and the missed opportunities to charge him for his earlier, unacknowledged crimes. This episode explores the murders of Judith Roberts in 1972 and Carol Wilkinson in 1977, and the two innocent men who were mistakenly charged with their killings

programme.title: Tour de France Highlights
programme.desc: Gary Imlach presents news on the second rest day, featuring a recap of the action so far and a look ahead to forthcoming stages. With features from reporters Daniel Friebe and Matt Rendell and insight from Pete Kennaugh

programme.title: Suspicion
programme.desc: Hiding in a country cottage, the five suspects attempt to uncover who framed them-or who among them is guilty.

programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Ainsley's Taste of Malta
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott begins a culinary tour of the Mediterranean island in its capital Valletta, where he discovers why Malta is such a melting pot of cultures and the impact this has on the cuisine. Ainsley tries bell ringing, witnesses a modern take on a Maltese classic, and finds out about Maltese sausage

programme.title: Celebrity Catchphrase
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts as contestants Antony Cotton, Matt Dawson and Stacey Dooley 'see it and say it' as they try to guess the familiar phrases hidden in animated clues. After the first elimination, the two remaining players battle to reach the Super Catchphrase round, where one of them could win 50,000 for the charity of their choice

programme.title: Lingo
programme.desc: Mother and son Becka and Connor from Johnstone in Scotland, Sylvia and Ishmail - a mother and son from Kent - and Sunderland-based Tinashe and wife Princess use their powers of deduction to work out words that appear in the Lingo grids and Puzzlewords. The last remaining duo have the opportunity to win the money they've banked earlier in the show to potentially double their winnings, or leaving with nothing. Adil Ray hosts

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. programme.title: The Chase

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather

programme.title: ITV Evening News
programme.desc: A round-up of the day's news headlines and talking points from the UK and around the world

programme.title: UEFA Women's Euro 2025
programme.desc: England v Italy (Kick-off 8.00pm). Coverage of the first semi-final, which comes from Stade de Genve in Switzerland. England continue their defence of the title after they came through a nail-biting quarter-final with Sweden, fighting back from 2-0 down to take the match to penalties and winning the shootout 3-2 despite failing to score four of their spot kicks. There was also drama in Italy's last-eight contest, which saw them claim a 2-1 win against Norway, with star striker Cristiana Girelli completing her brace in second-half stoppage time

programme.title: Shark! Celebrity Infested Waters
programme.desc: The famous faces discover their final mission will be to swim with 18-foot tiger sharks. Ade Adepitan struggles to master his special diving equipment during a training exercise and makes a mad dash for a boat with sharks all around him. Meanwhile, Lucy Punch and Ross Noble find themselves in 'predator alley', Helen George suffers a panic attack and falls behind the team during scuba training, and the stars enjoy a spectacular coral reef dive before learning about their next encounter

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: Yorkshire Ripper: The Secret Murders
programme.desc: Part one of two. Examining the police investigation into the crimes of serial killer Peter Sutcliffe, known as the Yorkshire Ripper, and the missed opportunities to charge him for his earlier, unacknowledged crimes. This episode explores the murders of Judith Roberts in 1972 and Carol Wilkinson in 1977, and the two innocent men who were mistakenly charged with their killings

programme.title: Tour de France Highlights
programme.desc: Gary Imlach presents news on the second rest day, featuring a recap of the action so far and a look ahead to forthcoming stages. With features from reporters Daniel Friebe and Matt Rendell and insight from Pete Kennaugh

programme.title: Suspicion
programme.desc: Hiding in a country cottage, the five suspects attempt to uncover who framed them-or who among them is guilty.

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Ainsley's Taste of Malta
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott begins a culinary tour of the Mediterranean island in its capital Valletta, where he discovers why Malta is such a melting pot of cultures and the impact this has on the cuisine. Ainsley tries bell ringing, witnesses a modern take on a Maltese classic, and finds out about Maltese sausage

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: Early morning chat show presented by Lorraine Kelly, with celebrity interviews, entertainment news, cooking tips, fashion features and musical guests.

programme.desc: A mix of celebrity chat, lifestyle features, advice and competitions

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: More celebrity interviews and topical debate from a female perspective

programme.title: ITV Lunchtime News
programme.desc: The key headlines from the day so far

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast

programme.title: Celebrity Catchphrase
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts as contestants Antony Cotton, Matt Dawson and Stacey Dooley 'see it and say it' as they try to guess the familiar phrases hidden in animated clues. After the first elimination, the two remaining players battle to reach the Super Catchphrase round, where one of them could win 50,000 for the charity of their choice

programme.title: Lingo
programme.desc: Mother and son Becka and Connor from Johnstone in Scotland, Sylvia and Ishmail - a mother and son from Kent - and Sunderland-based Tinashe and wife Princess use their powers of deduction to work out words that appear in the Lingo grids and Puzzlewords. The last remaining duo have the opportunity to win the money they've banked earlier in the show to potentially double their winnings, or leaving with nothing. Adil Ray hosts

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Richard from Birmingham, Jackie from East Kilbride, Emma from Hitchin and Lee from Ilkeston pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast

programme.title: ITV Evening News
programme.desc: A round-up of the day's news headlines and talking points from the UK and around the world

programme.title: UEFA Women's Euro 2025
programme.desc: England v Italy (Kick-off 8.00pm). Coverage of the first semi-final, which comes from Stade de Genve in Switzerland. England continue their defence of the title after they came through a nail-biting quarter-final with Sweden, fighting back from 2-0 down to take the match to penalties and winning the shootout 3-2 despite failing to score four of their spot kicks. There was also drama in Italy's last-eight contest, which saw them claim a 2-1 win against Norway, with star striker Cristiana Girelli completing her brace in second-half stoppage time

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: From the Ground Up
programme.desc: Documentary following Ian Wright's involvement in launching a girls' team at his childhood club Ten Em Bee

programme.title: Tour de France Highlights
programme.desc: Action from stage 14, which consisted of a 182.6km route from Pau to the ski resort of Luchon-Superbagnres. Gary Imlach presents, with analysis from Pete Kennaugh, commentary by Ned Boulting and David Millar, and interviews from reporters Daniel Friebe and Matt Rendell

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Shark! Celebrity Infested Waters
programme.desc: Lenny Henry, Lucy Punch, Helen George, Rachel Riley, Ade Adepitan, Dougie Poynter and Ross Noble head to the Bahamas to swim with man-eating sharks. Experts Danni Washington and Tristan Guttridge and shark attack survivor Paul de Gelder are the mentors whose mission is to help the celebrities conquer their fears and teach them to love this notorious predator

programme.title: John and Lisa's Weekend Kitchen
programme.desc: John Torode and Lisa Faulkner make four mouth-watering dishes with only five main ingredients, starting with a garlic and rosemary focaccia, followed by John's pink spaghetti. Following that are chicken and peanut butter scissor-cut noodles and moreish and fuss-free banana doughnuts.

programme.title: Flushed Away
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure featuring the voices of Hugh Jackman, Kate Winslet and Ian McKellen. Posh rodent Roddy St James leads a sheltered life in a Kensington mansion, with his every need catered for by his wealthy owners. But his life as a pampered pet comes to an end when he's flushed down the toilet to a subterranean world where the population is being threatened by an evil toad.

programme.title: Katie Piper's Weekend Escape
programme.desc: Katie is joined by Steps' Lee Latchford-Evans to make a mini allotment, hairdresser Michael Douglas and make-up artist Genevieve Turley transform a supportive sister, and JJ Goodman serves up more delicious drinks

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Love Your Weekend with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Joining Alan to provide the chat this time are Selina Scott, Pixie Lott and Tom Parker-Bowles, and we also meet some rare-breed Guernsey goats with a royal title.

programme.title: Ninja Warrior UK
programme.desc: Competitors from across the nation test their strength, speed and courage in this obstacle-course challenge, with celebrity contestants including professional skater Sylvain Longchambon, singer Joe McElderry, and Olympian snowboarder Aimee Fuller competing alongside members of the public. Hosted by Ben Shephard, Rochelle Humes and Chris Kamara

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Mrs Doubtfire
programme.desc: Comedy drama starring Robin Williams, Sally Field and Pierce Brosnan. When voiceover artist Daniel Hillard walks out of his day job, his wife Miranda decides it's time to walk out on him, and is granted custody of their children. Daniel is desperate to be with his kids, so when Miranda advertises for a nanny-cum-housekeeper he applies for the job in disguise.

programme.title: The Spy Who Loved Me
programme.desc: Spy adventure starring Roger Moore and Barbara Bach. James Bond sets out to stop an evil shipping magnate who is capturing nuclear submarines by means of a secret tracking device. Bond finds help in the unlikely shape of a beautiful KGB agent, and a formidable enemy in steel-toothed killer Jaws.

programme.title: Sean's Scotland
programme.desc: Sean travels to Perth and Kinross, visiting Loch of the Lowes Visitor Centre and Wildlife Reserve to learn about the ospreys that return there to mate

programme.title: The People's History Show
programme.desc: There is a visit to Dounreay nuclear power plant, Atta Yaqub learns about footballer-turned-writer Neil Paterson, and Jennifer Reoch finds out about the thread industry in Paisley

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Celebrity Catchphrase
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts as contestants Mark Bonnar, Alexandra Burke and Claire Sweeney 'see it and say it' as they try to guess the familiar phrases hidden in animated clues. After the first elimination, the two remaining players battle to reach the Super Catchphrase round, where one of them could win 50,000 for the charity of their choice

programme.title: Karen Pirie
programme.desc: Amid societal unrest in 1984, oil heiress Catriona Grant and her son Adam are kidnapped at gunpoint, but after sending two ransom notes the culprits unexpectedly fall silent and the pair are never seen again. When a man's body is discovered 40 years later in a quarry with a piece of evidence connected to the case, DI Karen Pirie is tasked with reopening the case with the first new lead in decades. Return of the crime drama based on the series of novels by Val McDermid, starring Lauren Lyle

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Breaking the Silence: Kate's Story
programme.desc: Former MP Kate Kniveton gives a frank and full insight into her experience of being abused and shamed into silence over 10 years by her ex-husband Andrew Griffiths, who was then a Conservative government minister. Kate also meets other high-achieving professional women who were secretly suffering appalling abuse behind closed doors and who, like her, felt there was no way they could escape the relationship. In this powerful documentary for the Exposure strand, Kate also sheds new light on the secretive world of the family court and shows how perpetrators can play the system to continue their abuse and how judges can get it badly wrong when it comes to protecting survivors and their children

programme.title: The Assembly
programme.desc: Footballer-turned-presenter Gary Lineker gets the grilling of a lifetime as he faces questions from autistic and learning-disabled interviewers, asking if he was forced out by the BBC and who the worst person he has worked with is. From the Hand of God to his first love, no question is off the table and no subject out of bounds when it comes to the Assembly's line of enquiry - expect revelations, chaos, and a lot of laughs

programme.title: Motorsport UK
programme.desc: Richard John Neil presents action from Snetterton featuring racing from the Wera Tools F4 British Championship and The Vertu MINI CHALLENGE.

programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott begins a culinary tour of the Mediterranean island in its capital Valletta, where he discovers why Malta is such a melting pot of cultures and the impact this has on the cuisine. Ainsley tries bell ringing, witnesses a modern take on a Maltese classic, and finds out about Maltese sausage

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: Early morning chat show presented by Lorraine Kelly, with celebrity interviews, entertainment news, cooking tips, fashion features and musical guests.

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: A mix of celebrity chat, lifestyle features, advice and competitions

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: More celebrity interviews and topical debate from a female perspective

programme.title: ITV Lunchtime News
programme.desc: The key headlines from the day so far

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast

programme.title: Celebrity Catchphrase
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts as contestants Antony Cotton, Matt Dawson and Stacey Dooley 'see it and say it' as they try to guess the familiar phrases hidden in animated clues. After the first elimination, the two remaining players battle to reach the Super Catchphrase round, where one of them could win 50,000 for the charity of their choice

programme.title: Lingo
programme.desc: Mother and son Becka and Connor from Johnstone in Scotland, Sylvia and Ishmail - a mother and son from Kent - and Sunderland-based Tinashe and wife Princess use their powers of deduction to work out words that appear in the Lingo grids and Puzzlewords. The last remaining duo have the opportunity to win the money they've banked earlier in the show to potentially double their winnings, or leaving with nothing. Adil Ray hosts

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Richard from Birmingham, Jackie from East Kilbride, Emma from Hitchin and Lee from Ilkeston pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast

programme.title: ITV Evening News
programme.desc: A round-up of the day's news headlines and talking points from the UK and around the world

programme.title: UEFA Women's Euro 2025
programme.desc: England v Italy (Kick-off 8.00pm). Coverage of the first semi-final, which comes from Stade de Genve in Switzerland. England continue their defence of the title after they came through a nail-biting quarter-final with Sweden, fighting back from 2-0 down to take the match to penalties and winning the shootout 3-2 despite failing to score four of their spot kicks. There was also drama in Italy's last-eight contest, which saw them claim a 2-1 win against Norway, with star striker Cristiana Girelli completing her brace in second-half stoppage time

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.desc: Documentary following Ian Wright's involvement in launching a girls' team at his childhood club Ten Em Bee
